author: n3tsurge
description: This capability involves identifying hosts within a network that are communicating with external IP addresses. It is essential for monitoring network traffic, detecting potential data exfiltration, and ensuring compliance with security policies. This capability can be implemented through network monitoring tools, log analysis, or other methods to track and analyze communication patterns with external IPs.

requirements.description: Access to relevant logging systems and data sources required for analysis.
Knowledge of indicators, patterns, and techniques relevant to this identification capability.
Tools and systems capable of collecting, processing, and analyzing relevant data.
Network monitoring tools and access to network infrastructure for analysis and control.

title: List Hosts Communicating with External IP

references.name: NIST SP 800-137: Information Security Continuous Monitoring (ISCM)
MITRE ATT&CK: Discovery Tactics and Detection Strategies
CISA Zero Trust Architecture - Monitoring and Analytics
